Tomorrow we will buy ice cream

Tomorrow they will buy ice cream

Himachal Pradesh (Shimla)
Himachal Pradesh is a mountain state near the Himalayas.
The location of Himachal Pradesh is North India.

Punjab (Chandigarh)
Punjab is on the border with Pakistan. It is the main state for the Sikh community. The Golden Temple is in Punjab.
The location of Punjab is North India.

Uttarakhand (Dehradun)
Uttarakhand is a state in north India crossed by the Himalayas. It has famous Hindu sites, like Rishikesh. It has a park to protect Tigers.
The location of Uttarakhand is North India.

Uttar Pradesh (Lucknow)
Uttar Pradesh is another state in the hills of North-east India. It also shares 3 borders with Bangladesh. It has many different tribal cultures and religious groups.
The location of Uttar Pradesh is North India.

Chandigarh (Chandigarh) (Union Territory)
Chandigarh is in north India. It is a shared capital of the states around it. It is a modern city.
The location of Haryana is North India.

Government of NCT of Delhi (Delhi) (Union Territory)
Government of NCT of Delhi is a Union Territory. New Delhi is located inside of Delhi. It is the capital of India and the location of all 3 branches of government.
The location of Delhi NCT is North India.

Jammu & Kashmir (Srinigar - Summer, Jammu - Winter) (Union Territory)
Jammu and Kashmir is a Union Territory in the south part of Kashmir. There has been conflict between India and Pakistan about this area since 1947. There is also conflict between India and China since 1959 in this area.
The location of Jammu & Kashmir is North India.

Ladakh (Leh) (Union Territory)
The most beautiful skies in India are in Leh, Ladakh. Ladakh is in the Kashmir region in India.
The location of Ladakh is North India.

Bihar (Patna)
Bihar shares a border with Nepal. It is divided by the Ganga.
The location of Bihar is North India.

Odisha (Bhubaneshwar)
Odisha is an eastern state which borders the water. It has famous ancient Hindu temples.
The location of Odisha is Central India.

Jharkhand (Ranchi)
Jharkhand is famous for waterfalls, temples and elephants and tigers. It is in eastern India.
The location of Jharkhand is North India.

West Bengal (Kolkata)
West Bengal is a state in east India. Its capital is Kolkata. Kolkata has a lot of British architecture.
The location of West Bengal is North India.

Rajasthan (Jaipur)
Rajasthan is in north-west India. It has three Parks to protect Tigers. Its capital, Jaipur, is called the "Pink City."
The location of Rajasthan is North India.

Gujarat (Gandhinagar)
Many lions live in Gir National Park in Gujarat.
The location of Gujarat is Central India.

Goa (Panaji)
Goa is famous for its beautiful beaches. Is is also famous for its spices. It is on the west coast of India.
The location of Goa is South India.

Maharashtra (Mumbai)
Maharashtra is on the border of the Arabian Sea to the west; and Gujarat to the North. It has a lot of business and industry. It is a leader in agriculture production and industrial production. It is also a leader in trade, transport and education. It has an ancient history.
The location of Maharashtra is Central India.

Dadra & Nagar Haveli & Daman & Diu (Daman) (Union Territory)
Dadra and Nagar Haveli is a district of the Union territory in West India.
The location of Dadra & Nagar Haveli UT is Central India.

Dadra & Nagar Haveli & Daman & Diu (Daman) (Union Territory)
Daman and Diu is a untion territory in West India.
The location of Daman & Diu UT is Central India.

Telengana (Hyderabad)
Telengana is a state in south India. It has a famous mosque, and many other historic buildings. It was a diamond-trading center in the past.
The location of Telangana is Central India.

Andhra Pradesh (Amaravati)
Andhra Pradesh grows rice and red chilis. It has a tradition of arts and crafts. Telugu is the language.
The location of Andhra Pradesh is South India.

Karnataka (Bangalore)
Karnataka is famous for lavish temples and technology.
The location of Karnataka is South India.

Kerala (Thiruvananthapuram)
The name Kerala means "Land of the coconut trees." It has the highest rate of literacy of all the states in India.
The location of Kerala is South India.

Tamil Nadu (Chennai)
Ooty Hill station in Tamil Nadu always has cool weather. It is a popular tourist site for the beauty of its Nature.
The location of Tamil Nadu is South India.

Puducherry (Puducherry) (Union Territory)
Puducherry was a French colony until 1954. It shares a border on the south-east by Tamil Nadu. It is by the seaside.
The location of Puducherry UT is South India.

Lakshadweep (Kavaratti) (Union Territory)
Lakshadweep is a group of small islands off the coast of Kerala. Most of the islands are closed to visitors. Kavaratti is the capital. It has many mosques and the Kavaratti Aquarium.
The location of Lakshadweep UT is South India.

Andaman and Nicobar Islands (Sri Vijaya Puram) earlier Port Blair
The Andaman Islands are known for their white-sand beaches and rainforests. It is a popular place to go diving.
The location of Andaman & Nicobar Islands UT is South India.

Madhya Pradesh (Bhopal)
Madhya Pradesh is a large state in central India. It has landmarks from many chapters of Indian history. It has national parks and protected tigers.
The location of Madhya Pradesh is Central India.

Chhattisgarh (Raipur)
Chhattisgarh is famous for temples and waterfalls. It is in the center part of India.
The location of Chhattisgarh is Central India.

Assam (Dispur)
Assam is famous for tea and silk. It has beautiful nature and wildlife.
The location of Assam is East India.

Sikkim (Gangtok)
Sikkim is a state in north-east India which shares a border with Tibet. It is in the mountains.
The location of Sikkim is East India.

Nagaland (Kohima)
Nagaland is in the mountains. It is famous for the beauty of its nature. It is also famous for its different tribes, arts, festivals and delicious food.
The location of Nagaland is East India.

Maghalaya (Shilong)
Maghalaya is famous for its nature, waterfalls, and traditional festivals. It is in north-east India.
The location of Meghalaya is East India.

Manipur (Imphal)
Manipura is a state in north-east India.
The location of Manipur is East India.

Mizoram (Aizawl)
Mizoram has dense bamboo jungles and green hills. It is called the Land of Blue Mountains. It has strong rivers and high waterfalls.
The location of Mizoram is East India.

Tripura (Agartala)
Tripura is a state in the hills of north-east India. It is surrounded by Bangladesh on 3 sides. It has buildings which blend Islam with Hindu styles.
The location of Tripura is East India.

Arunachal Pradesh (Itanagar)
Arunachal Pradesh is famous for beautiful nature and architecture. It is on the border with China.
The location of Arunachal Pradesh is East India.
